intro: Silene ohwii, commonly known as the Ohwii campion, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Silene ohwii has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruiting structure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
